long_desc.thetext:
It si now possible to filter bogus rpmlint errors and warnings on taskotron: 

https://pagure.io/taskotron/task-rpmlint/issue/5

https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Taskotron/Tasks/dist.rpmlint#Whitelisting_errors

Let's do that for python37 and later backport it to python3.

Fixed in python37

Proposal for python3 https://src.fedoraproject.org/rpms/python3/pull-request/28

python-pip-9.0.3-1.fc27, python3-3.6.5-1.fc27, python3-docs-3.6.5-1.fc27 has been pushed to the Fedora 27 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

See:

taskotron check: https://taskotron.fedoraproject.org/artifacts/all/18d43998-303b-11e8-9ee8-525400fc9f92/tests.yml/output.log

build log: https://kojipkgs.fedoraproject.org/work/tasks/846/25960846/build.log

*** WARNING: mangling shebang in /usr/lib/debug/usr/lib64/libpython3.6dm.so.1.0-3.6.4-20.fc28.x86_64.debug-gdb.py from #!/usr/bin/python to #!/usr/bin/python2. This will become an ERROR, fix it manually!
*** WARNING: mangling shebang in /usr/lib/debug/usr/lib64/libpython3.6m.so.1.0-3.6.4-20.fc28.x86_64.debug-gdb.py from #!/usr/bin/python to #!/usr/bin/python2. This will become an ERROR, fix it manually!

This files end in python3-debuginfo and that package does not require /usr/bin/python2, so it's not a serious problem. Yet we should fix this.
https://src.fedoraproject.org/rpms/python3/pull-request/30

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2018-1060 python: DOS via regular expression catastrophic backtracking in apop() method in pop3lib

long_desc.thetext:
Catastrophic backtracking vulnerability was found in Python. Exploitation of a regular expression in pop3lib's apop() method although limited by 2048 chars, can lead to denial of service.

Upstream issue:

https://bugs.python.org/issue32981

External References:

https://docs.python.org/3.6/whatsnew/changelog.html#python-3-6-5-final

Created python33 tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1563465]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2018-1061 python: DOS via regular expression backtracking in difflib.IS_LINE_JUNK method in difflib

long_desc.thetext:
Catastrophic backtracking vulnerability was found in Python. Exploitation of a regular expression in difflib.IS_LINE_JUNK method in servers that use difflib can lead to denial of service.

Upstream issue:

https://bugs.python.org/issue32981

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1563462]

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of fedora-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=1549192,1563462

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new
Added new parent flaw bugs 1549191 (CVE-2018-1060) to this tracking bug.
